Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Sharon Kleinbaum, Senior Rabbi and spiritual leader at Congregation Beit Simchat Torah located at 130 West 30th Street, New York, NY 10001.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Speaker Johnson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Sharon Kleinbaum, Senior Rabbi and spiritual leader at Congregation Beit Simchat Torah located at 130 West 30th Street, New York, NY 10001.

The Speaker (Council Member Johnson) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 10, 2020 be adopted as printed by Council Member Louis.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Louis moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 10, 2019 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca, Jr.)
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on related Application No. C 200123 ZSM (Cort Theatre) be subject to Council review.  This item is related to Application No. N 200124 ZRM.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Cort Theatre, Manhattan (C 200123 ZSM and N 200124 ZRM)

Items.Title:
By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca, Jr.)
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on related Application No. C 200303 ZSQ (42-11 9th Street Special Permit) be subject to Council review.  This item is related to Application No. N 200304 ZRQ.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 42-11 9th Street Special Permit, Queens (C 200303 ZSQ and N 200304 ZRQ)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to a study of the health impacts from gas stoves
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Study of the health impacts from gas stoves.

Items.Title: Resolution amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to changes in membership and chairmanships of the Standing Committees and Subcommittees of the Council.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to changes in membership and chairmanships of the Standing Committees and Subcommittees of the Council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the disposition of real property of the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disposition of real property of the city.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to protect New York State’s safety net providers and Special Needs Plans by eliminating the Medicaid pharmacy carve-out.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Protect NYS’s safety net providers and Special Needs Plans by eliminating the Medicaid pharmacy carve-out.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to additional freeboard for structures in the floodplain
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Additional freeboard for structures in the floodplain.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring covered entities to maintain a record of requests from persons requesting a reasonable accommodation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Requiring covered entities to maintain a record of requests from persons requesting a reasonable accommodation.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the police department to report on vehicles towed due to registration-related violations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to report on vehicles towed due to registration-related violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing motorcyclists to challenge parking violations electronically with photographic evidence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing motorcyclists to challenge parking violations electronically with photographic evidence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of cultural affairs to provide greater transparency on department spending.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of cultural affairs to provide greater transparency on department spending.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the establishment of a drag laureate program.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a drag laureate program.

Items.Title: Application No. 20215013 HAM (110 Lenox Avenue) submitted by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law and Article XI of the Private Housing Finance Law requesting waiver of the designation requirements and the requirements of section 197-c and 197-d of the Charter, approval of an Urban Development Action Area Project, and approval of a real property tax exemption, for properties located at 110 Lenox Avenue (Block 1599, Lot 70), 128 West 116th Street (Block 1825, Lot 49), 1971 7th Avenue (Block 1903, Lot 38), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 10, Council District 9.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 110 Lenox Ave, Manhattan (20215013 HAM)

Items.Title: Application No. C 200123 ZSM (Cort Theatre) submitted by Cort Theatre LLC and Clarity 47 LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 81-745 of the Zoning Resolution to allow a floor area bonus for the substantial rehabilitation or restoration of a listed theater, as set forth in Section 81-742 (Listed theatres), and to allow the bonus floor area to be utilized anywhere on the zoning lot, on property located at 138 West 48th Street a.k.a. 145 West 47th Street (Block 1000, Lots 7, 11, 49, 55, 56, 57, 58, and 59), in C6-5.5 and C6-7T Districts, within the Special Midtown District (Theater Subdistrict), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 5, Council District 4.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Cort Theatre, Manhattan (C 200123 ZSM)

Items.Title: Application No. N 200124 ZRM (Cort Theatre) submitted by Cort Theater LLC and Clarity 47 LLC pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying Article VIII Chapter 1 (Special Midtown District) for the purpose of amending the provisions of a special permit regulating theater rehabilitation bonuses, Borough of Manhattan, Community District 5, Council District 4.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Cort Theatre, Manhattan (N 200124 ZRM)

Items.Title: Application No. C 200303 ZSQ (42-11 9th Street Special Permit) submitted by RXR 42-11 9th Holdings LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-96 (Industrial Business Incentive Areas) of the Zoning Resolution to allow an increase in the maximum permitted floor area ratio in accordance with Section 74-963 (Permitted floor area increase) and, in conjunction therewith, to modify the quantity and size of the loading requirements of Section 44-50, in connection with a proposed twenty-story commercial building within an Industrial Business Incentive Area in an M1-4 District specified on the maps in Section 74-968 (Maps of Industrial Business Incentive Areas), on property located at 42 11 9th Street (Block 461, Lot 16), Borough of Queens, Community District 2, Council District 26.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 42-11 9th Street Special Permit, Queens (C 200303 ZSQ)

Items.Title: Application No. N 200304 ZRQ (42-11 9th Street Special Permit) submitted by RXR 42-11 9th Holdings LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, adding an Industrial Business Incentive Area to Article VII, Chapter 4 (Special Permits by the City Planning Commission) and updates to Section 74-76 (Modifications of Use, Bulk, Parking and Loading Regulations in Industrial Business Incentive Areas), in connection with a proposed twenty-story commercial building within such Industrial Business Incentive Area, on property located at 42-11 9th Street (Block 461, Lot 16), Borough of Queens, Community District 2, Council District 26.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 42-11 9th Street Special Permit, Queens (N 200304 ZRQ)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the  Acting President Pro Tempore for these proceedings.

Items.Title: Application No. C 200086 ZMK (1501-1555 60th Street Rezoning) submitted by 1529-33 60th Street, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 22d, changing from an M1-1 District to an R7A District and establishing within the proposed R7A District a C2-4 District, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 12, Council District 44.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 1501-1555 60th Street Rezoning, Brooklyn (C 200086 ZMK)

Items.Title: Application No. N 200087 ZRK (1501-1555 60th Street Rezoning) submitted by 1529-33 60th Street, LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying APPENDIX F for the purpose of establishing a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing area, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 12, Council District 44.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 1501-1555 60th Street Rezoning, Brooklyn (N 200087 ZRK)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned the virtual proceedings.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Note: The only item with the General Order vote of 47-0-0 was Res. No. 1528.

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

LU No. 705 & Res. No. 1530,  45-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Menchaca.
LU No. 706 & Res. No. 1531,  45-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Menchaca.

See files for individual votes.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
